title: 103_hr929
content: Increase in the threshold requirement for wages in employment taxes on domestic services from $50 to $300. Coordination of collection of domestic service employment taxes with collection of income taxes through a new section added to the Internal Revenue Code. The general rule for domestic service employment taxes requires returns to be filed on a calendar year basis by the 15th day of the fourth month following the employer's taxable year. No deposits or installments are required for these taxes. Domestic service employment taxes are subject to estimated tax provisions, treating them as a tax imposed by chapter 2 for the employer's taxable year. Adjustments may be made in the application of estimated tax regulations. The term 'domestic service employment taxes' refers to taxes on remuneration for services in a private home, excluding certain types of service. Adjustments may be made in the application of estimated tax regulations for employers' taxable years. The term 'domestic service in a private home of the employer' excludes certain services. Regulations may exempt employers liable for other employment taxes. The Secretary can prescribe necessary regulations for coordinating the assessment and collection of employment taxes with income taxes. Additionally, agreements can be made to collect state unemployment taxes. The Secretary is authorized to enter agreements with states to collect state unemployment taxes on remuneration for domestic service in a private home. Taxes collected under these agreements are treated as domestic service employment taxes for coordination with income taxes. Amounts collected are transferred to the state's account in the Unemployment Trust Fund. Any amount collected under an agreement for state unemployment taxes on domestic service remuneration is transferred to the State's account in the Unemployment Trust Fund. The collected amount is treated as a tax imposed by chapter 23 for coordination with income taxes. The term 'State' is defined as per section 3306(j)(1). The amendments made by section 3510 coordinate the collection of domestic service employment taxes with income taxes, applying to remuneration paid after 1993.
